intro: Cacalia cordiformis, commonly known as heartleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Cacalia cordiformis is often found in association with other shade-tolerant plants, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
